intro: Zilla schouwioides, commonly known as the Cape rosewood, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
